title: Towards a Perspectivist Turn in Argument Quality Assessment
author: Julia Romberg (GESIS - Leibniz Institute for the Social Sciences), Maximilian Maurer (GESIS - Leibniz Institute for the Social Sciences), Henning Wachsmuth (Leibniz University Hannover), Gabriella Lapesa (GESIS - Leibniz Institute for the Social Sciences)
relevance_why: The paper discusses argument quality assessment methods which could be relevant for improving automated evaluation systems in audio-related arguments and discussions.
background: This paper aims to explore subjective assessments of argument quality, acknowledging the variability in evaluation by different annotators due to personal and contextual factors.
contribution: The paper introduces a systematic review of existing argument quality datasets to propose a framework for more diverse and representative assessments.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Previous argument quality assessments primarily relied on aggregated data, which often masked individual evaluator perspectives and biases.
technical_comparison.novelty: This work emphasizes the importance of non-aggregated annotations to better capture the variety of perspectives, allowing for more nuanced understanding and modeling of argument quality.

key_innovation: Advocates for a perspectivist approach in argument quality assessment which treats individual annotator perspectives as valuable rather than as errors.
real_world_impact: This shift could significantly enhance the design of argument analysis tools, making them more inclusive of diverse opinions and potentially improving user engagement in discussions.
limitations: The authors note challenges related to the lack of socio-demographic diversity and transparency in existing datasets.

new_terms.perspectivist turn: **Perspectivist turn** refers to an analytical approach that prioritizes multiple viewpoints and interpretations in assessing data and outcomes, particularly in subjective tasks.

open_sourcing: The resulting database of the reviewed datasets is publicly accessible at https://github.com/juliaromberg/perspectivist-turn-aq
